    • Constructor Detail

      • SimRoeMetz

        public SimRoeMetz(double[] u,
          double[] var_t,
          int[] n,
          java.util.Random rand,
          int useBias)
        Sole constructor. Upon invocation, verifies the parameters, initializes class members, performs simulation experiment, and processes the results.
        Parameters:
        u - Contains experiment means. Has 2 elements.
        var_t - Contains variance components. Has 18 elements.
        n - Contains experiment sizes. Has 3 elements.
        rand - Random number generator initialized with seed from GUI. No guarantee that the generator is at any particular position within its sequence for a given seed.
        useBias - Indicates whether to used biased estimates in the results of the simulation

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Used when calling SimRoeMetz as a standalone application via command-line.
        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments. First element is experiment means, second element is components of variance, third element is experiment sizes, fourth element is seed for RNG, fifth element specifies whether biased estimates will be used.

      • printResults

        private void printResults()
        Prints the results of a simulation experiment to standard out. Only used when main method for this class is invoked.

        Simulated scores for truth=1, modality=1

      • doSim

        private void doSim(double[] var_t,
         java.util.Random rand)
        Performs one simulation experiment based on the Roe & Metz model generalized for 18 variances. Fills four t-matrices (class members t00, t01, t10, t11) with results
        Parameters:
        rand - Random number generator initialized with seed from GUI. No guarantee that the generator is at any particular position within its sequence for a given seed.

      • processSimExperiment

        private void processSimExperiment()
        Performs conversions on results of the simulation experiment so that decompositions and AUC can be determined.

      • convertTMatrices

        private double[][][][] convertTMatrices()
        Reorganizes the t-matrices into format that is convenient for variance analysis by iMRMC methods. Additionally creates the t0 and t1 matrices which are modality-independent
        Returns:
        Array consisting of all converted t-matrices necessary for variance analysis

      • createDMatrices

        private int[][][][] createDMatrices()
        Creates design matrices for the simulated experiment. The design matrices for both normal and disease cases both indicate a fully-crossed design (consist of all 1's), since a simulated experiment does not have any missing scores.
        Returns:
        Array containing design matrices for normal cases and disease cases.

      • fillGaussian

        public static double[] fillGaussian(double scalar,
                    java.util.Random rand,
                    int x)
        Fills a vector with x random numbers according to a Gaussian distribution.
        Parameters:
        scalar - Width of distribution
        rand - Random number generator initialized with seed from GUI. No guarantee that the generator is at any particular position within its sequence for a given seed.
        x - length of vector to fill
        Returns:
        1-d array containing random gaussian numbers

      • fillGaussian

        public static double[][] fillGaussian(double scalar,
                      java.util.Random rand,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Fills a matrix with x * y random numbers according to a Gaussian distribution.
        Parameters:
        scalar - Width of distribution
        rand - Random number generator initialized with seed from GUI. No guarantee that the generator is at any particular position within its sequence for a given seed.
        x - length of array to fill
        y - width of array to fill
        Returns:
        2-d array containing random gaussian numbers
